explanation: not in the intended manner, or out of position, or wrong
sentence: There are too many people involved, and something is bound to go awry.
sentence_gap: There are too many people involved, and something is bound to go ____.

explanation: to attract or impress someone so much that they cannot think in a sensible way
sentence: He was completely bewitched by her beauty.
sentence_gap: He was completely _________ by her beauty.

explanation: a stick with a piece that fits under the arm, that you lean on for support if you have difficulty in walking because of a foot or leg injury
sentence: Martin broke his leg and has been on crutches for the past six weeks.
sentence_gap: Martin broke his leg and has been on ________ for the past six weeks.

explanation: (formal or law) the fact of deliberately not doing what you ought to do, especially when it is part of your job; (especially of a building) a state of not being cared for
sentence: The old railway station was in a state of dereliction.
sentence_gap: The old railway station was in a state of ___________.

sentence: The sheer size of their armed forces is a disquieting factor for neighboring countries.
sentence_gap: The sheer size of their armed forces is a ___________ factor for neighboring countries.

explanation: the very great size, effect, etc. of something; the fact of something being very serious
sentence: People are still coming to terms with the enormity of the disaster.
sentence_gap: People are still coming to terms with the ________ of the disaster.

explanation: an area of water where fish are caught so they can be sold
sentence: The depletion of fisheries has serious impacts on food security.
sentence_gap: The depletion of _________ has serious impacts on food security.

explanation: to shine with a light that is sometimes bright and sometimes weak
sentence: I felt a cold draft and the candle started to flicker.
sentence_gap: I felt a cold draft and the candle started to _______.

explanation: to mix one thing in with another in a way that is not regular
sentence: Lectures will be interspersed with practical demonstrations.
sentence_gap: Lectures will be ____________ with practical demonstrations.

explanation: to make someone feel fresher, healthier, and more energetic
sentence: We were invigorated by our walk.

explanation: to annoy someone, especially by asking them something many times
formal or old-use; any very serious infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people
sentence: They have flood, pestilence, fire, and earthquake, and governments are another calamity.
sentence_gap: They have flood, __________, fire, and earthquake, and governments are another calamity.

explanation: formal; weak and cowardly; frightened of taking risks
sentence: He's too pusillanimous to stand up to his opponents.
sentence_gap: He's too _____________ to stand up to his opponents.

explanation: informal; to annoy or make angry
sentence: Nothing ever seemed to rile him.

explanation: formal; the state of not being active and having no energy or enthusiasm; the state of reduced activity that some animals experience during the winter
sentence: In the heat they sank into a state of torpor.
sentence_gap: In the heat they sank into a state of ______.
